mdRecord.dcterms:description: Enclose a receipt of Madame du Tilleul for a box sent by Gouverneur Morris; offer their services to Jefferson on every occasion in Paris and America; this is possible because of their connections with the best houses in America; Madame du Tilleul requests to be told when Jefferson arrives; hope that he will arrive soon; offer Jefferson the same bed that Benjamin Franklin stayed in on his visit to Le Havre; requested that Gouverneur Morris also insist that Jefferson use this bed.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Franklin, Benjamin, 1706-1790
Morris, Gouverneur, 1752-1816
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1789 July 26, Le Havre, [France], to [Thomas] Jefferson, Paris, [France].
